column4: could you explain how upstream translations get integrated in to the language packages? (I'm a member of the DutchTeam)
right now they have to be updated in the source package first
later you can throw them into Rosetta
I will build new language packs soon anyway
so now i should update the my upstream translations manually in Rosetta?
either that, or update the source package; the latter will always work
but if they are upstream, why not just do a new release and ask us to package it?
i'll have to ask the upstream-maintainer?
oh, I thought you are an upstream for a package; of course you can also send the translations directly to him
but uploading them into Rosetta is easiest for now
thanx ... already filed a bug in Malone though ... should I clear it?
not necessary, adding the translations to the source package is a good idea anyway
what about the ubuntu additions to gnome which don't have(?) public sources and aren't in Rosetta (like 'update-manager')?
hmm, if they are not in rosetta, that's a bug
i'll try to make a list
carlos just told me that it is there
ok ... ubuntu's world is a fast world indeed! I'll continue to try the other packages... thanks!
Administrator help needed. gnome-app-install has not yet been setup for translation through Rosetta.
